snippet: In a new poll, 62 percent said Mrs. Clinton could bring about real change in Washington, compared with 51 percent for Mr. Sanders.
abstract: New York Times/CBS News survey finds 62 percent of Democratic primary voters believe Hillary Rodham Clinton would be able to change Washington, as opposed to 51 percent who say same of Sen Bernie Sanders; primary voters also overwhelmingly believe Clinton will be Democratic nominee, with 52 percent supporting Clinton, as opposed to 33 percent who back Sanders.

byline.original: By PATRICK HEALY and MEGAN THEE-BRENAN
byline.contributor: Dalia Sussman and Marina Stefan contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: In a new poll, 62 percent said Mrs. Clinton could bring about real change in Washington, compared with 51 percent for Mr. Sanders.

headline.main: Poll Shows Hillary Clinton Is Seen as More Likely Than Bernie Sanders to Be Effective
headline.print_headline: Poll Shows Clinton Is Viewed as More Likely Than Sanders to Be Effective
